Ward boy breaks newborn’s leg for incessant crying Ward boy, deployed at the Intensive Care Unit of the hospital, was annoyed by child's crying which was causing hindrance in his sleep. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 6, 2017 7:26 PM The infant, born to a person identified as Varnik, was in critical state at the time of birth and was taken to ICU. (Source:Twitter) 
Shocking visuals have surfaced from a Roorkee Hospital where a ward boy on duty allegedly broke the leg of an infant after he was annoyed by child’s incessant crying. CNN-News 18 reported that the ward boy, deployed at the Intensive Care Unit of the hospital, was annoyed by child’s crying which was causing hindrance in his sleep. The infant, born to a person identified as Varnik, was in critical state at the time of birth and was taken to ICU. 
Here’s the video of the incident tweeted by Times Now: Shocking visuals from a Roorkee Hospital where ward boy on duty broke the leg of an infant after he was annoyed by child’s incessant crying pic.twitter.com/V15OZJ2TxH 
— TIMES NOW (@TimesNow) February 6, 2017 
The child was kept in ICU on third day of his birth as his condition didn’t improve. The ward boy was also deployed at the same ICU. Angered by child’s continued crying, the man got angry, and broke his leg. The entire incident was recorded in CCTV camera. Please Wait while comments are loading...
